comment.author: 8793648@N06
comment._content: Interesting as I'm looking for photo of a shop on the opposite side of George, which housed George Tyrrell's bookshop in the 1950s-60s.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
The same view today -
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/6943828966/]
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/8793648@N06] Hi opsbooks, James Tyrrell's bookshop was at 281 George Street. It was on the same side of the street as this photo (the west side), but further south - just south of the Margaret Street corner and opposite Hunter Street. Hope that helps you track down a photo.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/8793648@N06] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] I think 281 George Street is marked in this photo - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2633059520/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
See also - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5393623929/]

Not sure about the date -  could be after 1908, because the tramway "T" pylons have been replaced.  If they were there in the first place?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Aha! Found the 1899 Kerry photo I was looking for. It shows no Tramway "T" pylons for this section of George St, and also that the entire block was rebuilt some time after 1899. McInerney's Commercial Hotel (not Gunther's) is on the Essex St corner - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2582676666/] from.ph/28153

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: I would need to check the dates but side of George Street was demolished to widen the road c 1910 - I think these are the new buildings but I can't remember the details - will try to look at home tonight!

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: Ah okay so this photo is post 1908/1909, when these new buildings along the west side of George Street were built. The original ones were demolished to widen George Street. I suspect that they would have been fairly new at this point!

comment.author: 8793648@N06
comment._content: Having finally thought to have a look for a book in my collection bought from Tyrrell's in the early 1960s, I can confirm that the Tyrrell's double-fronted shop I used was, according to the Tyrrell's rubber stamp, located at 202-204 George St. They moved from there to Crow's Nest. But I need to check old phone books - one day - to discover when they moved from 281 to 202-204. All other references on the net fail to mention the 202-204 shop. Looking at the 1930s fire appliances map, it seems more likely that a double-fronted store would have been at 204-206.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/8793648@N06] I've found a reference to Tyrrell's at 202 George Street in 1964. - www.google.com.au/search?q=tyrrell%27s+bookshop+202-204+g... My hunch would be that Tyrrell's moved from 281 to 202 sometime after James Tyrrell's death in July 1961?
